etymology.description: 目(目) (mù, "eye") + 卩(卩) (jié, "kneeling person") = a kneeling figure with large eye -> see
etymology.interpretation: The combination of a human figure and an eye visually represents the act of seeing. The eye symbolizes vision, while the person emphasizes the human context of this action, making the meaning intuitive.
etymology.simplification: 见(見) is derived from using a cursive variant of the character in place of the traditional form.

examples.chinese: 我昨天见到她(我昨天見到她)。
太阳升起时(太陽升起時)，我看见了大海(我看見了大海)。
examples.pinyin: Tàiyáng shēng qǐ shí, wǒ kàn jiàn le dàhǎi.
examples.english: When the sun rose, I saw the sea.

examples.chinese: 在公园里(在公園裡)，我见到了老朋友(我見到了老朋友)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gōngyuán lǐ, wǒ jiàn dào le lǎo péngyǒu.
examples.english: In the park, I met an old friend.
